sentence.Network_en: At this, some of the others chime in with memories of prewar deprivations.
sentence.Network_cn: 听到这话，另外那些人中有几个开始加进来讲述他们对战前贫困生活的回忆。

sentence.Network_en: They are endeavoring to reproduce the social conditions of prewar days.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们正竭力(在作品等中)再现战前的社会情况.

sentence.Network_en: The matrix of abundant cropland group is prewar Feng Tian joint venture.
sentence.Network_cn: 丰田集团的母体是战前的丰田联合企业.

entry.tran: 战前的；（尤指）第二次世界大战以前的
entry.def: Pre-war is used to describe things that happened, existed, or were made in the period immediately before a war, especially the Second World War, 1939-45.

means.word_mean: 1. existing or belonging to a time before a war;
